timeline.bodyText: XML comments? I know you need to do this but I did not understand why we need this. What are we serializing a string to and why?
timeline.author: vinagesh

timeline.bodyText:
turns
{"_t":2,"_s":null,"_rc":"[{\"token\":\"+RID:~WftkAMiSVqReAQAAAAAAAA==#RT:4#TRC:100#ISV:2#IEO:65551#FPC:AgEAAAAMAFEBAMARQP9/n4Eqjw==\",\"range\":{\"min\":\"\",\"max\":\"05C1DFFFFFFFFC\"}}]","_q":"SELECT * FROM digitaltwins where IsOccupied = true"}
into
"{\"_t\":2,\"_s\":null,\"_rc\":\"[{\\\"token\\\":\\\"+RID:~WftkAMiSVqReAQAAAAAAAA==#RT:4#TRC:100#ISV:2#IEO:65551#FPC:AgEAAAAMAFEBAMARQP9/n4Eqjw==\\\",\\\"range\\\":{\\\"min\\\":\\\"\\\",\\\"max\\\":\\\"05C1DFFFFFFFFC\\\"}}]\",\"_q\":\"SELECT * FROM digitaltwins where IsOccupied = true\"}"
timeline.author: azabbasi

timeline.bodyText: In C# you had added a test to be enabled later to test pagination. I think we should add it here as well to ensure next page really goes to the next page.
timeline.author: vinagesh

replies.bodyText: Agreed, as I mentioned in the discussions page, we need a bigger task that makes sure all APIs that have paging hit that code path.
replies.author: azabbasi

timeline.author: abhipsaMisra

timeline.bodyText: IoT Hub query tests add a buffer or retry to account for any sort of propagation delay between when a twin is created and when query can find it. Does this test pass reliably?
timeline.author: timtay-microsoft

replies.bodyText: Yes it does. If we see flakiness later we can add some idle time.
replies.author: azabbasi

timeline.bodyText: You can move the try down until the digital twin is created successfully. If the finally block executes before the digital twin is created, the thrown exception will just be "Failed to delete digital twin" rather than the exception that caused the pre-mature finally block
timeline.author: timtay-microsoft

replies.bodyText: yes, but then if the digitaltwin fails to create it will not get to the finally block that will delete the model ...
replies.author: azabbasi
